English: I think this is where my tent used to be.
They occupied our base for a long time. It will be a while before we get the stench out.
Now that the battle is over, care to celebrate with the boys?
It depends on what you have on mind.
I think there was a fresh shipment of vodka recently...
Comrade Rashiv, your presence is requested at the commanding centre.
I see. Thank you, comrade, I'll go right away.
Deliver some of the vodka to the squad, Yashin, let them have fun. I'll see what they need of me.
Before you, comrade Lemontov, is our next objective.
We are going back to Everon?!
Don't be surprised. Everon was our initial goal and it still is.\nIt is high time we reclaim that island and bring it back into our fold.
Our first attack was ill-prepared and rushed, but we are ready this time.\nI will get personally involved and victory shall be swift.
I see. So I am stripped of the command, then?
Yes, comrade, I need a man of your calibre on the front lines. You are a great strategist, but even better Spetsnaz.
Comrade Zubarev will lead the army from now on and you shall report to him.\nI will remain here as an advisor and observer.
Of course, comrade Volkov.
Now, we already devised a plan. Give a quick read to this, you are going out tonight.
You are not wasting any time, comrade Volkov.
The dice have been cast, comrade Lemontov. The pieces are moving across the board and we have to act fast.
I believe you will keep that in mind. There is a lot at stake here, perhaps too much.
Following my orders is all I ask, comrade Lemontov, let me handle the rest.
We are about to be part of a historic moment here and we cannot afford any mistakes.
I am loyal to the Soviet Union, comrade Volkov. You can count on that.
That must suffice.\nI know we had our differences, comrade Lemontov, but I am glad we can put them behind us for the good of our country.
Good luck on Everon, comrade Rashiv should be on his way.\nReclaim that island, comrade Lemontov, and I shall make you the greatest hero of the Soviet union. Dismissed.
Rashiv? That can't be a coincidence. Does he know about... ?
Grigory, I was told to see you.
Sergei, things are moving quickly. I'll tell you more on the way.
Where are we going?
Back to Everon, boy. Hopefully, for the final time.
Chapter III\n\nR E C L A M A T I O N
